title: Tule Lake Unit: Nearby Attractions
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Nearby Attractions            Nearby Attractions       The Tule Lake unit is near the small town of Tulelake CA, and near thousands of acres of public lands full of scenic views, historic locations and recreational activities. Below are just some of the nearby attractions that await.        Blue Grotto cave entrance at Lava Beds NPS Photo, David Hays   Lava Beds National Monument  Located 27 miles from the Tule Lake Unit the Lava Beds National Monument features more than 700 caves, Native American rock art sites, historic battlefields and campsites, and a high desert wilderness experience. The Lava Beds National Monument is open year round and provides free tours daily in the summer. To learn more about Lava Beds National Monument.         Bird floating on Tule Lake National Wildlife Refuge. U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service   Tule Lake National Wildlife Refuge The refuge is very close to Tule Lake approximately 8 miles from the town via East West Road. The refuge is home to many birds and is a great place for bird watching as well as hunting. To learn more about Tule Lake National Wildlife Refuge.      More information:  Klamath Basin Visitor Info Tulelake, CA Chamber of Commerce Volcanic Legacy Scenic Byway  Seasonal Events:  Tulelake-Butte Valley Fair (September) Winter Wings Festival (February)  Birding, wildlife:  Klamath Basin National Wildlife Refuges Klamath Basin Birding Trail  National Forest and National Park Sites:  Modoc National Forest Klamath National Forest Crater Lake National Park Lassen Volcanic National Park Oregon Caves National Monument Whiskeytown-Shasta-Trinity National Recreation Redwood National and State Parks  Area State Parks:  California State Parks Oregon State Parks
